page.title: 13SCHOOL LIFE
page.content: The primary school takes children from 5 years of age up to 11 years. At 11 years they transfer to King Edward the Sixth school in Retford. In the primary school the mornings are mainly spent on language subjects, such as reading, creative writing, spelling and grammar, storu and drama; also maths work which is based on a published scheme. The afternoons are spent on topic work which usually includes science, geography, history and environmental studies. Games and sports are played and include football, netball, hockey, fitness training and general games skills. Swimming is taught at the Retford Sports Centre pool and all the children attend swimming sessions on Friday afternoons. A bus is provided to take them to Retford.
